thread.title: "Soulmates" Georgia Kousoulou and boyfriend Tommy Mallet explain how to beat TOWIE's dreaded love curse

author: mirror.co.uk
title: "Soulmates" Georgia Kousoulou and boyfriend Tommy Mallet explain how to beat TOWIE's dreaded love curse

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter celebs newsletter follow @mirrortv subscribe

text:
"Soulmates" Georgia Kousoulou and boyfriend Tommy Mallet explain how to beat TOWIE's dreaded love curse They've had drama in the past but these days Georgia and Tommy are stronger than ever Share Comments By Lara Martin 15:55, 28 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next TOWIE returns for a 20th series Watch this video again Watch Next James Argent discovers his shocking amount of twe 0:35 TOWIE feminist row hits fever pitch 0:54 Video will play in TOWIE is back and heading to Tenerife Share this video Watch Next Sorry Megan McKenna and Pete Wicks , but Georgia Kousoulou and Tommy Mallet are claiming the title of TOWIE power couple as the show enters its 20th series.
The loved up pair, who have remained drama-free in recent series, described themselves as “soul mates” while explaining the secret behind a long-lasting relationship on screen.
“Being with someone for the right reasons and actually loving them [is important],” said Tommy.
He added: “The difference between Georgia and me and some other couples is that we’re soul mates – I knew we were the moment we got together.”
Tommy and Georgia return to TOWIE on Sunday (Photo: ITV Picture Desk) They're a firm favourite among fans (Photo: FameFlynet) Read More Watch out Pete Wicks and Megan McKenna! James Lock and Yazmin Oukhellou make debut as TOWIE power couple Georgia agreed, saying: “The key is you need to stay as a team – the minute you let anyone doubt that then you’ll have problems. You can’t show weakness, you have to stay unified. You have to be careful what you tell people as well.”
The blonde beauty also claimed to take credit for “changing” Tommy, turning him from the loud, party loving boy she first met into the man he is today.
“When I met Tommy he was so lairy but I believe I changed him, and I’ll have that crown forever,” she said.
“When I first met him the whole cast told me not to get with him, but I didn’t listen. I had to be quite strict with him and set some rules, but it did work!”
Laughing together on TOWIE (Photo: ITV) They claim to be Essex's King and Queen Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Share this video Watch Next Georgia and Tommy moved into their first home together last year, in the same building as good friends Cara de la Hoyde and Nathan Massey, who won Love Island 2016.
There have frequently been rumours that marriage could be on the cards for 2017, but they’ve both said they’re not rushing into anything and enjoy life as it is.
“I think he is going to propose soon, but I think right now we love being together - and having moved in we’re just taking it all in,” Georgia told Daily Mail last year.
“I would HATE to rush things. I would hate him to feel that he needs to put a ring on my finger. I really just want it to happen naturally.”
*TOWIE returns Sunday, March 5 at 10pm on ITVBe
